cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba

motion.direction: N (slow drift – expected to turn NNW to NW)

cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move northwest, crossing the northern Yucatan late Monday, then accelerate north-westward across the central Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near southeast Louisiana / Mississippi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Rio Lagartos (Yucatan, Mexico) and Cozumel
weather_observation.impacted_coast: western Cuba, northern Yucatan Peninsula, northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Mid-Atlantic stations listed in table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (local amounts generally 1-3 inches expected in Mid-Atlantic)
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system could bring gusty easterly winds 25-35 mph late Thu–Fri, but tropical-storm-force winds are not expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Baltimore’s upper Chesapeake location
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain possible late Thu–Fri as post-tropical remnants pass inland to the west
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor tidal anomalies and brief harbor restrictions possible if pressure gradient tightens, but no direct tropical hazards are forecast
